title: Display not showing or extending in Teams meeting
problem_statement: User is in a meeting or conference and the external screen, projector, or extended display is not showing correctly during a Microsoft Teams meeting.
description: 1) Press Windows + P. 2) Select "Duplicate" for the same screen or "Extend" for extended display. 3) Unplug and re-plug the HDMI or USB-C cable once. 4) Go to Settings → System → Display → Click "Detect". 5) Confirm the screen is visible in Teams.

action.next_step: Check if the external screen or projector is now visible and correctly displaying in the Teams meeting.

title: Audio not working in Teams meeting
problem_statement: User is unable to hear sound or audio is coming from the wrong device during a Microsoft Teams meeting.
description: 1) Click the speaker icon in the taskbar. 2) Open Sound settings. 3) Set Output device to "Jabra" or "Polycom". 4) Open Microsoft Teams → Settings → Devices. 5) Select the same speaker and microphone.

action.next_step: Play a test sound or ask someone in the meeting to confirm audio is working.

title: Password expired or password not working
problem_statement: User is unable to log in because the password has expired or the current password is not working.
description: 1) Connect to VPN. 2) Open the password reset page: http://172.31.36.138/RDWeb/Pages/en-US/password.aspx 3) Follow the instructions to reset the password. 4) Try logging in again. 5) If the user has forgotten the password or is unable to reset it, contact the IT Admin.

action.next_step: Confirm whether the user was able to reset the password successfully or needs admin assistance.

title: Laptop is slow or performance issue
problem_statement: User reports that the laptop is running slow, freezing, or taking too long to open applications.
description: 1) Check laptop uptime: Press Ctrl + Shift + Esc → Task Manager → Performance → CPU → check Uptime. If uptime is more than 3–5 days, restart the laptop. 2) Restart the laptop if not already done. 3) Press Ctrl + Shift + Esc to open Task Manager and close unnecessary applications. 4) Go to Task Manager → Startup tab and disable unnecessary startup programs. 5) Press Windows + R, type %temp%, and delete all temporary files. 6) Open Disk Cleanup and clean system files. 7) Ensure at least 20% free disk space is available. 8) Run Windows Update and install pending updates.

action.next_step: Confirm whether system performance improved after checking uptime and completing the cleanup steps.

title: Outlook email login issue
problem_statement: User is unable to log in to Outlook email or Outlook keeps asking for password.
description: 1) Confirm internet connection is working. 2) Verify username and password by logging in at https://outlook.office.com. 3) If password fails, check if password is expired and reset it. 4) Open Outlook → File → Account Settings → Account Settings → Repair account. 5) Sign out and sign back into Outlook. 6) Restart the laptop and try again. 7) If issue persists, contact IT Admin.

action.next_step: Confirm whether the user is able to access Outlook or Teams successfully after the steps.

title: Account locked due to failed login attempts
problem_statement: User account is temporarily locked due to multiple failed login attempts.
description: 1) Inform the user that the account is locked for 1 minute due to failed login attempts. 2) Wait for 1 minute. 3) Ensure the correct password is being used. 4) Try logging in again after the lock period. 5) If the account does not unlock after waiting, contact IT Admin.

action.next_step: Confirm whether the user was able to log in successfully after the lock duration.
